info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 5:42PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Stephens and southwestern Oconee Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 541 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Toccoa, or 5 miles southeast of Tallulah Gorge State Park, moving east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Toccoa, Walhalla, Westminster and Long Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
